title: Are these for controlling the heat pumps with Wifi
content:
We have 3 heat pumps (all ducted).  Yesterday I found 3 of these in the attic space.  Since they say Mitsubishi and Wifi, I am assuming that are Wifi controllers for the heat pumps.
The question is, are they really Wifi controllers.  And how do they work ?  They need to be wired to something.  Do they need additional hardware on the heat pump ?  Do they work with no indoor highwall unit ?


I just found an online installation manual to install it inside a wall unit.  I would still like to know if they can be used with the outdoor unit or the ducted system in the attic space.

comments.text: Reading the manual i think you should first locate the port if it exists in any place if they exist then it should be a simple matter of running some jumper wires from this port To the controller and check if it flashes or connectible to router then you can probably double tape it somewher
I have similar looking WiFi interface for my Mitsubishi aircon. It connects to the indoor unit, not the outdoor unit

answers_data.content: It appears that they are generic Wifi controllers for Mitsubishi Heatpumps (ACs).  I sold them to someone who just slotted them into his units and they worked.
